content: must stash sock by candon leopold this is a basic top down sock pattern written in three sizes with two different heel pattern options materials needed - needles size 1 or whatever size gets you gauge dpns long circular needle for magic loop or 9inch circulars if you prefer - must stash perfect sock yarn ritz sock yarn or similar fingering weight yarn - stitch markers - stitch holder or waste yarn - tapestry needle to weave in ends gauge - 9 stitches per inch and 10 rounds per inch after blocking in stockinette sizes - small child s size 2-6 woman s size 3-6 6 2 inch circumference medium woman s size 6-9 men s 5-7 7 inch circumference large woman s size 8-12 or men s 8-10 8 inch circumference cuff cast on 56 64 72 stitches if working on dpns separate stitches as evenly as possible over 3 needles if working magic loop divide stitches in half if working on 9 inch needles place stitch marker at end for all methods join in the round row 1 k2 p2 repeat to end repeat row 1 for 20 row total or until you reach your desired cuff length it is also pleasing to the eye if you finish your ribbed cuff at a color change if you are lucky enough to be working with self striping yarn leg this step is easy knit a lot or a little if you prefer a shorter leg length a solid go to length is 6 inches from the cuff from here you make work the slip_stitch heel and gusset 1 or the afterthought heel 2 1 slip_stitch heel and gusset *note heel flap is worked back and forth across half of the total sock stitches the other half will be rejoined after working the heel and will become the top of the foot/instep *tip if you are working with self striping sock yarn and still want to knit a heel flap and gusset without altering your striping sequence here s what you do drop working yarn after you ve separated the stitches you will be working for the heel flap but do not cut it pick up the opposite end of your yarn if pulling from the inside of the ball while knitting the leg use the end on the outside of the cake and knit heel flap and heel turn with that end when you get to the top of the foot stitches instep stitches pick up the yarn you were previously working with and tadaa your striping sequence will be uninterrupted set up row knit 28 32 36 stitches place stitches on one needle if working on dpns turn work row 1 ws slip 1 stitch with yarn in front p1 repeat to end row 2 rs slip 1 stitch knit to end repeat row 1&2 a total of 18 20 24 times for a total of 36 40 48 row worked heel turn aka sock magic row 1
